ygData.subject: Re: Having problems using Heritrix.
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks for the quick reply. I m running Windows XP. I reviewed the install docs, and found that I didn t create the profile folder under the conf directory.

Thanks for the quick reply.

I'm running Windows XP.

I reviewed the instal=
l docs, and found that I didn't create the
profile folder under the conf di=
rectory. Now, when I create a job
using that profile it works fine. I just =
ran a crawl on a website, and
all the URL's are resolving their DNS IP addr=
esses.

When I look at the default profile. I realize I don't know much abo=
ut
configuring a crawl job on Heritrix. Could use some more documentation
o=
n what all the modules do, and when to use them.

What software do you guys=
 use to read the ARC files generated by a crawl?

Thanks for you help.

I'm=
 think this thing is complex to setup, and I'll be back to question
some mo=
re questions.


> Have you customized the crawl configuration at all -- esp=
ecially with 
> regard to the PreconditionEnforcer, FetchDNS, or Scope comp=
onents?
> 
> What happens if you try using a bundled profile, with only the=
 minimal 
> changes necessary to run -- a valid 'user-agent' and 'from' -- =
on a 
> representative seed?
> 
> On what OS are you running Heritrix?
> 
>=
 FYI, most of the core team uses Eclipse; Heritrix 1.x should build and 
> =
run in Eclipse without requiring Maven at all.
